portfolio-item.name: Tribal Destroyers
portfolio-item.summary: A modest-sized PC gamers' guild community website I made for a friend.

narrative.p: Implemented with limited CSS knowledge and the ubiquitous table-based layout, getting that goon's arm to properly float off the main body made this relatively simple design a big pain. Looking at this code to package it up makes me cringe. I'm still trying to figure out how I made this work all those years ago.
This gamers' group was centered on the Tribes series. I don't know much about any of the games as I never played any of them but this was made as a favor for a friend.
narrative.h4: What the heck is d3fect studios?
narrative.p: In case you're wondering, d3fect studios was my design nom de plume back then, .com and everything! Of course, with the clientele being what it was (i.e., broke teenagers without the means to pay), I never charged anything and it went nowhere. Oddly enough, a squatter picked it the domain name within days after I let it expire...
